So the application as a whole knows that the data came from a database?  

If so, I'd recommend introducing a data access layer to reduce this 
coupling.  Clients of this layer would only know that it serves up data, 
not exactly where that data comes from.  The upshot is that everything 
at a "higher" level could be tested without a database.  At the end of 
the day, the database is just an implementation detail.
